item.title: Our Favorite Xbox 360 Games Ever
item.content:encoded:
The Xbox 360 turns 20 on November 22, and it had many at Insider Gaming thinking about the time spent with Microsoft’s most popular console. From experiencing titles like Grand Theft Auto 5 for the first time to the peak of the Halo franchise, there were no shortage of great games released on the Xbox 360 that went on to become lifelong favorites.

So, some of the staff at Insider Gaming decided to have a little fun and put together lists of their favorite Xbox 360 games. Now, no one is saying these are the best games on the system. These are just the ones everyone had the most fun playing when they came out.

It’s always fun to look back at what was loved. And who knows, maybe there’s a game you might have forgot about that you want to revisit or play for the first time. Check out the staff’s favorites and leave your thoughts in the comments and over in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Controversial Kirby Air Riders Bikini Skin Has Already Been Removed
item.content:encoded:
Kirby Air Riders allows you to customize special skins and sell them for in-game currency. One skin has taken it too far, and the already-infamous bikini skin has been rendered unavailable on the Kirby Air Riders Machine Market.

Sometimes you need to take a step back and realise what you’re saying and typing. But it’s all true: A controversial customizable bikini skin is no longer obtainable in Kirby Air Riders. The humorous but risqué outfit can no longer be bought, and it’s probably a warning to all players that you need to tread carefully with any sus designs.

Kirby Air Riders Bikini Skin Is Now Unavailable

Within 24 hours of the game coming out, users were making eye-opening skins and selling them on the game’s Machine Market. Everything is bought and traded using the game’s currency.

One particular skin went viral very quickly: A design showing Chef Kawasaki wearing a micro-bikini. If you didn’t know, Chef Kawasaki is a regular character in the Kirby universe, and their default getup is usually just some kind of cooking apron.

According to Automaton: “Chef Kawasaki wearing a micro bikini has been a running joke among a portion of Japanese Kirby fans for quite a few years. The headcanon seems to have resulted from fans looking at Chef Kawasaki’s standard attire – naked save for a single apron – and thinking, ‘Isn’t that kind of lewd?'”

So, once you give players the appropriate tools, they are sure to create inappropriate outfits. Kirby Air Riders’ technology finally allowed the Chef Kawasaki bikini look to happen.

Have you rinsed your eyes yet? Well, it only took hours for the design to be removed.

It was fun while it lasted, but this dual-wields as both an action and a warning to Kirby Air Riders players: Think twice before putting Chef Kawasaki—or anyone, for that matter—in a micro-bikini and selling it on the Machine Market.

Have you seen any other bizarre or hilarious outfits in the Kirby Air Riders Machine Market? Feel free to share them through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.
